teachers often train students to write stylized five-paragraph essays with clear ideas and transitions. while more advanced skills like style, analysis or development of voice may be rewarded, they aren't necessary for a passing score. if you look at the sample papers, the ones that consistently score in the upper ranges are a strict five-paragraph formula of introduction, body, conclusion, said denise graham, the english department head at John Ferguson senior high in west miami-dade. "a student who strays from that on an exam could be penalized." that brought me right back to high school social

's intensive care David Ward for tick paralysis in a month. nambour hospital emergency physician David Ward said ticks were usually a problem at this time of year. he said the blood suckers' saliva was toxic to humans. the saliva has a toxin in it and the toxin is what causes the paralysis, it builds up over time, dr David Ward said. it causes an ascending paralysis... starting at the hands and feet and working its way up towards the other muscles of the body.
